name: Vertex Studio
description: A marketing website for a technologically advanced design agency that creates artwork, websites, motion graphics, and brand collateral for enterprise businesses. Features industry-specific landing pages with customized problem-solution-CTA messaging.

stories.title: Initialize Next.js project with Biome and Tailwind
stories.description: Bootstrap the marketing website using create-next-app CLI with TypeScript, Tailwind CSS, and Biome for linting. This establishes the foundational architecture.
acceptance: Project created using: npx create-next-app@latest vertex-studio --typescript --tailwind --eslint --app --src-dir --use-npm
Navigate to project: cd vertex-studio
Remove ESLint in favor of Biome: npm remove eslint eslint-config-next && rm .eslintrc.json
Install Biome: npm install --save-dev @biomejs/biome
Initialize Biome: npx @biomejs/biome init
Configure biome.json with recommended rules, formatter enabled, and organizeImports enabled
Update package.json scripts: lint uses 'biome check --apply .', format uses 'biome format --write .'
Tailwind CSS v3+ configured with custom design tokens in tailwind.config.ts
TypeScript strict mode enabled in tsconfig.json
Base layout component created at src/app/layout.tsx with metadata and viewport configuration
Global CSS imports Tailwind directives and custom CSS variables for brand colors
Project runs successfully with npm run dev on localhost:3000

stories.title: Establish design system and brand components
stories.description: Create a cohesive design system with reusable components that reflect the agency's technologically advanced aesthetic. Includes typography, color palette, spacing system, and core UI components.
acceptance: Brand color palette defined: primary (electric blue #0066FF), secondary (deep purple #6B21A8), accent (vibrant cyan #00D4FF), neutrals (slate scale)
Typography scale using Inter for headings and system-ui for body, with fluid sizing using clamp()
Spacing system follows 4px base unit (4, 8, 12, 16, 24, 32, 48, 64, 96, 128)
Button component with variants: primary, secondary, outline, ghost - all with hover/focus states
Card component with glass morphism effect option and subtle border gradients
Section component with max-width container and responsive padding
Animated gradient backgrounds using CSS animations for hero sections
Icon system using Lucide React for consistent iconography
Motion utilities using CSS transitions and transforms (no heavy animation libraries)
Dark mode support using Tailwind's dark: modifier with system preference detection
All components follow accessibility best practices (WCAG 2.1 AA compliance)

API routes cached appropriately

No layout shifts during page load

Automated accessibility testing passes (axe or similar)

projectSetup: Replace ESLint with Biome: npm remove eslint eslint-config-next && npm install --save-dev @biomejs/biome && npx @biomejs/biome init
Configure Biome in biome.json with formatter, linter, and organizeImports enabled
Enable TypeScript strict mode in tsconfig.json for better type safety
Set up path aliases in tsconfig.json (e.g., @/* for src/*)
codeQuality: Run Biome check before every commit: npx biome check --apply .
Keep components small and focused on single responsibility
Extract reusable logic into custom hooks
Use Server Components by default, Client Components only when needed
designSystem: Define design tokens in Tailwind config or CSS custom properties
Create consistent spacing using Tailwind's spacing scale
Use semantic color names (primary, secondary) not literal (blue, purple)
Build mobile-first, then enhance for larger screens
Ensure all interactive elements have clear hover/focus states
performance: Use Next.js Image component for all images
Implement dynamic imports for below-the-fold content
Use static generation (generateStaticParams) for all predictable routes
Monitor Core Web Vitals during development
accessibility: Test with keyboard navigation throughout development
Maintain proper heading hierarchy on every page
Ensure sufficient color contrast for all text
Add descriptive alt text to all meaningful images
Use semantic HTML elements (nav, main, section, article)
seo: Write unique, compelling titles and descriptions for every page
Include target keywords naturally in content and headings
Implement structured data for rich search results
Ensure all pages are discoverable and in sitemap
Use descriptive, keyword-rich URLs for all pages
industryPages: Lead with the client's problem, not your capabilities
Use industry-specific terminology and pain points
Include social proof relevant to that industry
Make the CTA specific and low-commitment
Connect problems directly to solutions - show the transformation
